001package com.randomnoun.common;
002
003/* (c) 2013 randomnoun. All Rights Reserved. This work is licensed under a
004 * BSD Simplified License. (http://www.randomnoun.com/bsd-simplified.html)
005 */
006
007import java.io.*;
008
009
010/**
011 * Utility class to copy streams synchronously and asynchronously.
012 *
013 * 
014 * @author knoxg
015 */
016public class StreamUtil {
017    
018
019    /**
020     * Creates a new StreamUtils object.
021     */
022    public StreamUtil() {
023    }
024
025    /** Copies the data from an inputStream to an outputstream (used to mimic
026     *  pipes).
027     *
028     *  @param input The stream to retrieve information from
029     *  @param output The stream to send data to
030     *  @param bufSize buffer size in bytes
031     *  
032     * @throws IOException
033     */
034    public static void copyStream(InputStream input, OutputStream output, int bufSize)
035        throws IOException {
036        int bytesRead;
037        byte[] buffer = new byte[bufSize];
038
039        while ((bytesRead = input.read(buffer)) != -1) {
040            output.write(buffer, 0, bytesRead);
041            output.flush();
042        }
043    }
044    
045    /** Copies the data from an inputStream to an outputstream 
046    *
047    *  @param input The stream to retrieve information from
048    *  @param output The stream to send data to
049    *  
050    * @throws IOException
051    */
052    public static void copyStream(InputStream input, OutputStream output)
053                throws IOException 
054    {
055        copyStream(input, output, 4096);
056        }    
057
058    /** Reads all available data from an InputStream, and returns it in a
059     *  single byte array.
060     *
061     * @param input The stream to receive information from
062     * @return A byte array containing the contents of the stream
063     * @throws IOException
064     */
065    public static byte[] getByteArray(InputStream input)
066        throws IOException {
067        ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
068
069        copyStream(input, baos, 1024);
070
071        return baos.toByteArray();
072    }
073
074    /** Returns a thread that, when started, will pipe all data from one
075     *  inputstream to an outputstream. The thread will complete when the
076     *  inputStream returns EOF.
077     *
078     *  @param input The stream to retrieve information from
079     *  @param output The stream to send data to
080     *  @param bufSize buffer size in bytes
081     */
082    public static Thread copyThread(InputStream input, OutputStream output, int bufSize) {
083        // not terribly sure why variables accessed from within anonymous classes
084        // need to be final, but hey. Hopefully this is just final within the
085        // scope of this method call. Which would make sense.
086        final InputStream f_input = input;
087        final OutputStream f_output = output;
088        final int f_bufSize = bufSize;
089
090        return new Thread() {
091            public void run() {
092                try {
093                    copyStream(f_input, f_output, f_bufSize);
094                } catch (IOException e) {
095                    // not much we can do about this, unfortunately.
096                    // could wrap in a runtime exception, I guess.
097                        // yeah, let's do that.
098                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
099                }
100            }
101        };
102    }
103
104    /** Scans this input stream until the text in 'searchText' is found. Returns
105     * the number of bytes skipped if the search text was found, or -1 if the text
106     * was not found.
107     * 
108     * @param input The input stream to scan
109     * @param searchText The text we are searching for
110     * 
111     * @throws IOException if an IO Exception occurs reading the stream
112     */    
113    public static int indexOf(InputStream input, String searchText) throws IOException {
114        int bytesRead = 0;
115        int matched = 0;
116        int ch;
117        byte[] compare = searchText.getBytes();
118        int    compareSize = compare.length;
119        while (true) {
120            ch = input.read();
121            if (ch==-1) { return -1; }
122            bytesRead++;
123            if (ch==compare[matched]) {
124                matched++;
125                if (matched==compareSize) {
126                    return bytesRead;
127                }
128            } else {
129                matched = 0;
130            }
131        }
132    }
133
134    /** Reads this input stream until the text in 'searchText' is found. Returns
135     * a String containing the data read, including the searchText. Returns null if the text
136     * was not found.
137     * 
138     * @param input The input stream to scan
139     * @param searchText The text we are searching for
140     * 
141     * @throws IOException if an IO Exception occurs reading the stream
142     */    
143    public static String readUntil(InputStream input, String searchText) throws IOException {
144        //int bytesRead = 0;
145        int matched = 0;
146        int ch;
147        byte[] compare = searchText.getBytes();
148        int    compareSize = compare.length;
149        ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
150        while (true) {
151            ch = input.read();
152            if (ch==-1) { return null; }
153            //bytesRead++;
154            baos.write(ch);
155            if (ch==compare[matched]) {
156                matched++;
157                if (matched==compareSize) {
158                    return baos.toString();
159                }
160            } else {
161                matched = 0;
162            }
163        }
164    }
165    
166    /** Returns a thread that, when started, will pipe all data from one
167     *  inputstream to an outputstream. The thread will complete when the
168     *  inputStream returns EOF. The output stream will also be closed.
169     *
170     *  @param input The stream to retrieve information from
171     *  @param output The stream to send data to
172     *  @param bufSize buffer size in bytes
173     */
174    public static Thread copyAndCloseThread(InputStream input, OutputStream output, int bufSize) {
175        // not terribly sure why variables accessed from within anonymous classes
176        // need to be final, but hey. Hopefully this is just final within the
177        // scope of this method call. Which would make sense.
178        final InputStream f_input = input;
179        final OutputStream f_output = output;
180        final int f_bufSize = bufSize;
181
182        return new Thread() {
183            public void run() {
184                try {
185                    copyStream(f_input, f_output, f_bufSize);
186                    f_output.close();
187                } catch (IOException e) {
188                    // not much we can do about this, unfortunately.
189                    // could wrap in a runtime exception, I guess.
190                        // yeah, let's do that.
191                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
192                }
193            }
194        };
195    }
196    
197    
198    
199}
